com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface modifyItemAssociations

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface modifyItemAssociations

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document modifyItemAssociations(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The modifyItemAssociations adds, modifies or deletes associations for an item.

    • Method Detail

      • modifyItemAssociations

        org.w3c.dom.Document modifyItemAssociations(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException

        The modifyItemAssociations adds, modifies or deletes associations for an item. Associations are a logical link between two or more items, an item and a category, or an item and a query. The AssociationType describes the link, having values such as cross-sell, up-sell, preferred substitutions and supersession. In addition, the user can define custom AssociationTypes which can also be passed as part of the input xml. When processing, the value of the AssociationTypes is not validated to determine if it is an existing AssociationType.

        For example, a particular shirt can be associated as a cross-sell with a tie. When the shirt is ordered by a customer the associated tie cross-sell may be displayed as an option.

        For example, model 'Model2' of a toy can be associated as a preferred substitute for the a 'Model1' toy. When 'Model1' toy is ordered by a customer the associated 'Model2' toy can be shipped.

        This preferred substitution is primarily used to deplete the inventory of the preferred substitute before the original item. This type of substitution is useful only when both items are very similar to each other.

        To add or modify an association, pass the association data in the AssociationList\Association element of the input xml.

        To delete an association, pass the association data in the AssociationList\Remove element of the input xml.

        Note: Items should only be associated to items, categories, and queries within the same enterprise.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:

          The AFTER_MODIFY_ITEM_ASSOCIATION event under ITEM_DEFINITION transaction is raised after successful execution of the modifyItemAssociations API.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: Modify Item Association Event XML
          Template Support: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnviroment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
